turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Perfluorooctanoic acid.
turn.1: What are the health effects of Perfluorooctanoic acid?
turn.2: The new ATSDR analysis derives provisional Minimal Risk Levels (MRLs) of 3x10 mg/kg/day for PFOA and 2x10 mg/kg/day for PFOS during intermediate exposure.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: An attempt to regulate PFOA in food packaging occurred in the US state of California in 2008.
turn.6: A bill, sponsored by State Senator Ellen Corbett and the Environmental Working Group, was passed in the house and senate that would have banned PFOA, PFOS, and seven or more related fluorinated carbon compounds in food packaging starting in 2010, but the bill was vetoed by Governor Schwarzenegger.
turn.8: The bill would have affected fluorochemical manufacturers outside of the state.
turn.10: Schwarzenegger said the compound should be reviewed by the newly established, and more comprehensive, state program.
turn.11: What are the main health effects?
turn.12: Fluorotelomer-based products have been shown to degrade to PFOA over periods of decades;   PFOA is a carcinogen, a liver toxicant, a developmental toxicant, and an immune system toxicant, and also exerts hormonal effects including alteration of thyroid hormone levels.
